snippet: As Iftikhar Muhammad Chaudhry steps down as chief justice this week, his fight against Pakistan’s military rulers looms large in his legacy — as does his failure to reform a weak legal system.
abstract: Iftikhar Muhammad Chaudhry, Pakistani chief justice known for his fight against country's military rulers, is stepping down after eight years; while some credit Chaudhry with saving country's democracy, critics point out his personal flaws and failures in reforming weak legal system.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Taha Siddiqui from Lahore, Pakistan, Saba Imtiaz and Zia ur-Rehman from Karachi, Pakistan, and Salman Masood from Islamabad, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: As Iftikhar Muhammad Chaudhry steps down as chief justice this week, his fight against Pakistan’s military rulers looms large in his legacy — as does his failure to reform a weak legal system.

headline.main: Pakistan’s Chief Justice Leaves a Mixed Legacy
headline.print_headline: Pakistan’s Chief Justice Leaves a Legacy of Independence and Failings
